newsitem.title: UK: Laura Ashley hit by executives resignations.
newsitem.headline: Laura Ashley hit by executives resignations.

text.p: British retailer Laura Ashley was hit by a double resignation and it appears a rebellion was brewing at the company, The Financial Times said on Friday.
Julie Ramshaw resigned as merchandise director after just 17 months and Dominic Lavelle, the finance director for UK and Europe, also quit.
"The company, which last month shocked the market with a profits warning, denied there was any disagreements between the chief executive and those quitting.
The newspaper quoted one retail analyst who said the departures could "blow the recovery out of the water."
The company, with operations in Europe and North America, is in the process of restructuring to produce better returns from its fashion and home furnishing businesses.
Analysts said the stock had been a victim of over-hyped expectations.
